content.question: If <math alttext="3 times x squared, plus 5 times x squared, times y squared, equals 2 y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></math>, then <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator negative 6 x, and denominator 20 x y, minus 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>20</mn><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator negative 10 x, times y squared, minus 6 x, and denominator 10 times x squared, times y, minus 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 minus 6 x, minus 10 x, times y squared, and denominator 10 times x squared, times y, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 6 x plus 10 x, times y squared, plus, 10 times x squared, times y, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>x</mi><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator negative 10 x, times y squared, minus 6 x, and denominator 10 times x squared, times y, minus 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
